parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From phulasso; a guarding or, the act, the person; figuratively, the place, the condition, or, the time, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
Properly, feminine of Ludios; Lydia, a Christian woman: -Lydia.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
